main event: On 17 February 1953, personnel of the 752nd ACAW Squadron at Port Austin, Michigan, sighted an unidentified flying object. The object was observed visually and tracked on radar, with a change in color from red to white and back to red again. The object appeared to be extremely bright and moved at a very high speed before disappearing in a short period of time.
interesting points: The object changed color from a bright red to white and then back to a bright red, appearing extremely bright and brighter than a star.
The object was observed visually for 4 minutes and detected on radar for 17 minutes, moving on a course of 180 degrees at 25 knots.
Both visual and electronic sightings were made by personnel with three or more years of experience in radar.
Weather conditions at the time of sighting showed visibility and ceiling to be unlimited with a temperature of approximately 28 degrees Fahrenheit.
No known meteorological or other disturbances or activity existed at the time of the sighting or in the vicinity.
